Articles.Content:
Herro fellow Kerbolnauts!

So after lots of RL work, I'm back (some may remember me tinkering on some stuff with Extraplanetory Launchpads)

I got a few small parts in the pipe, which i will release here on this page.

I did tried to upload the first on spaceport today, but it just gave me a cryptic ERROR message, without any details. So for now i will resort to upload my stuff on my personal Dropbox account.

Without further ado:

AMOK Dynamics Stuff

AMK-101 Alkaline Fuel Cell v0.1

This part will introduce an alkaline fuel cell in the early techtree (survivability), which will draw on liquid fuel and oxydizer to produce less than half as much energy as an RTG,

while maintaining aproximately the same footprint and attachment restrictions.

Why liquid fuel and oxydizer? Easy! An alkaline fuel cell uses hydrogen and oxygen to produce electricity, both valid rocketpropellants.

Altho liquid fuel in KSP is most likely RP1, i found it a suitable enough coincidence to introduce an energy source early in the techtree.

The technology for the alkaline fuel cell is as old as 1880 and thus totally valid in my eyes.

The wasteproduct water will get instantly used by the kerbals to produce tasty snacks!

DOWNLOAD VIA DROPBOX

Installation

Just copy the contents of the ZIP-folder into the GameData folder!

Usage

Just attach like any RTG

Touch the part to toggle the fuelcell on/off.

One fuel cell normally produces enough energy to keep the MK1 pod going.

Two are normally required to keep an MK1 pod AND SAS/ASAS going.

The fuelcell has no own battery! It feeds its energyproduction into the pod or any batteries you got onboard.

Incompatibilities

None known, and i use a load of typical mods myself.

Changelog

v0.1 - Initial Release

This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.
Very good. I've been waiting for one of these for a while.

no... no no... you aren't... OH GOD SECOND LIFE IS STILL HAUNTING ME!

I recognize your Amok Dynamics logo from Second Life. Glad to see another excellent modeler and programmer on the forums!

Thanks guys!

I've got smelter furnaces up my sleeve for Extraplanetory Launchpads. I've made them in all current diameter sizes, and scaled their energy consumption, mass and everything to their formfactor.

I've initally made them for EL directly. But i think taniwha does not want to change/add parts to the current mod.

I'm seriously thinking about making a complete overhaul package with everything needed.

I mean i still got the halfdone orbital dock, launchpad and excavators for that mod. Just needs a scanner, rocketpart factory and assembly habitate.

But before i dabble into that stuff i need to clear matters with taniwha first. This includes the smelter furnace you can see above.
Very nice that stock-a-like feel is what really makes mods good
Is this the Same Aeon Voom From Secondlife ?? >_> Formerly Incharge of the Vice Stuff?

Is this the Same Aeon Voom From Secondlife ?? >_> Formerly Incharge of the Vice Stuff?

The very same, however i was never "in charge" of VICE. I used it like any other maker who dabbled in it. But since it did not got updated since 2008, i decided to make my own system, MCE.
